title: In a SUPER MARIO WORLD
body_text:
"The Axe" Adams Takes Charge!
A Land Full of Mushrooms and Stars!
Championship Chase
victor
Christopher Adams
oversaw this 164th presentation. What did the iconic,
BoxBall
founder come up with? What tricks did he have up his sleeve?
The Rules
- and decorations - were simple yet creatively done. Teams were formulated via Adams's handpicked leading generals, Alysha Kelly and Ashley Hoppe. Then, the classic two-team war got under way, with use of 4, yes
4
, very special MarioBrothers-related rims!
First, the "extra life"
green mushroom
allowed for a full-team regeneration, with an endless number of uses. Two poisonous
purple mushrooms
however were hung nearby, and if hit, eliminated the person who made contact. And finally, the bright and shiny yellow
star
- certainly a Megill favorite, who went on to hit this three times - gave "GodMode-like" powers for a substantial 3-minute time frame!
These new additions coupled with the fury of Mother Nature made this 164th spectacle just that - a spectacle. It just goes to show that anything than can happen in
ECD's
most unpredictacle month!
Flash Results by Game
:
Kelly: 2, 5
Hoppe: 1, 3, 4
The Match
: Ashley Hoppe defeated Alysha Kelly, 3 - 2. Each of the ladies participated in their debut captains match.
Moments & Stars
: Justin Wolf's painful nutshot on Chris Adams, even though Adams caught the ball; Kevin Fitzpatrick accidently pelted in the ear by John Tronolone; Juan Londono's fancy 360 spin-elimination on Ryan Letsche; Jon Yochum falling victim to numerous shots even though he was already out; John Tronolone and Kevin Megill unfairly blocking with their umbrellas
Attendance
: 18, comprised of 14 men and 4 women
New Players
: Bill Houke
Other Notes
: DODGEBALL 164:
Beware the Axe
was the 32nd
Wet War
, that last being
DODGEBALL 157
in late-September. Like last week, the tennis lights went off at 9pm and play did not switch to the front courts.
________________________________________
________
Mid-Season Main Event Up Next!
Seven years of wrestling events, clinking beers, and uncontrollable laughter are angrily shoved aside for the Season 17 mid-war. Legendary figures of the game take out their frustrations on their friend-turned-foe  when
John Tronolone
battles
Ryan Letsche
in an match with double the stipulation - the first-ever
White Flag - CREAMation
encounter!
body_html:
"The Axe" Adams Takes Charge!
A Land Full of Mushrooms and Stars!

Championship Chase victor Christopher Adams oversaw this 164th presentation. What did the iconic, BoxBall founder come up with? What tricks did he have up his sleeve?

The Rules - and decorations - were simple yet creatively done. Teams were formulated via Adams's handpicked leading generals, Alysha Kelly and Ashley Hoppe. Then, the classic two-team war got under way, with use of 4, yes 4, very special MarioBrothers-related rims!

First, the "extra life" green mushroom allowed for a full-team regeneration, with an endless number of uses. Two poisonous purple mushrooms however were hung nearby, and if hit, eliminated the person who made contact. And finally, the bright and shiny yellow star - certainly a Megill favorite, who went on to hit this three times - gave "GodMode-like" powers for a substantial 3-minute time frame!

These new additions coupled with the fury of Mother Nature made this 164th spectacle just that - a spectacle. It just goes to show that anything than can happen in ECD's most unpredictacle month!

Flash Results by Game:
Kelly: 2, 5
Hoppe: 1, 3, 4

The Match: Ashley Hoppe defeated Alysha Kelly, 3 - 2. Each of the ladies participated in their debut captains match.
Moments & Stars: Justin Wolf's painful nutshot on Chris Adams, even though Adams caught the ball; Kevin Fitzpatrick accidently pelted in the ear by John Tronolone; Juan Londono's fancy 360 spin-elimination on Ryan Letsche; Jon Yochum falling victim to numerous shots even though he was already out; John Tronolone and Kevin Megill unfairly blocking with their umbrellas
Attendance: 18, comprised of 14 men and 4 women
New Players: Bill Houke
Other Notes: DODGEBALL 164: Beware the Axe was the 32nd Wet War, that last being DODGEBALL 157 in late-September. Like last week, the tennis lights went off at 9pm and play did not switch to the front courts.

________________________________________________

Mid-Season Main Event Up Next!

Seven years of wrestling events, clinking beers, and uncontrollable laughter are angrily shoved aside for the Season 17 mid-war. Legendary figures of the game take out their frustrations on their friend-turned-foe when John Tronolone battles Ryan Letsche in an match with double the stipulation - the first-ever White Flag - CREAMation encounter!
